JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant , who had previously taken refuge in GPE for political reasons , fled to GPE illegally . He was then recognised as a refugee by the ORG as part of a group of CARDINAL asylum seekers ( “ the CARDINAL group ” ) who had similarly fled GPE to GPE in DATE . Following an agreement between the NORP authorities and the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( ORG ) , the applicant was granted a temporary residence permit in GPE to reside at a place to be determined by ORG . The applicant , however , was not recognised as a “ refugee ” proper , within the meaning of the DATE LAW , but was merely given “ alien ” status under LAW no . CARDINAL on “ the Residence and Travel of Aliens in GPE ” . He was also notified by ORG that the terms of his residence in GPE did not involve an eventual resettlement in a third country .
On DATE the President of the ORG notified the respondent Government of the introduction of the application under LAW .
According to the information provided by the respondent Government in their observations , the applicant has been issued a temporary residence permit .
On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that he had fled GPE to GPE , where he sought asylum .

On DATE the respondent Government informed the ORG that despite his valid permit to reside in the city of PERSON , the applicant had left the city without permission and that they had no information as to his whereabouts .
